About
About
As a Management Consultant at xto10x, I help organizations unlock scale by applying deep expertise in market research, team leadership, and go-to-market strategy. I partner with cross-functional teams to drive data-backed decisions that improve efficiency, customer experience, and overall business outcomes.

Previously, I managed a ‚Çπ250Cr annual business at Bajaj Auto, leading a network of 40+ dealers and 20+ vendors to deliver 30% YoY volume growth and a 10% increase in market share. I also spearheaded digital performance marketing initiatives across Google Ads, YouTube, and Facebook, generating 200+ qualified leads in 30 days with an 11% lead-to-sale conversion rate.

Recently completed the Google Digital Marketing & E-Commerce certificate program-a series of online courses that cover the intricacies of digital marketing and E-commerce.

An MBA graduate in International Business from IIFT Delhi, I bring a strategic mindset and strong analytical skills, with a proven track record of designing and executing GTM strategies, including the rollout of electric vehicle sales initiatives.
‚Ä¶see more

   ‚Ä¢ 3rd+

Pre-Seed Investor @DeVC || Prev: Founder @Verak (acq. by ID)
Pre-Seed Investor @DeVC || Prev: Founder @Verak (acq. by ID)
Visit my website
1mo ‚Ä¢ 
 1 month ago ‚Ä¢ Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn
A year after Binny Bansal sold his $1bn stake in Flipkart in 2018, he began laying the foundations for his next venture: a ‚ÄúMcKinsey for Startups‚Äù ‚§µÔ∏è

At an event in Bangalore last year, Binny explained his motivations for setting up xto10x ‚Üí ‚ÄúInstead of making a thousand mistakes, if we can help other startups make a hundred or even a few hundred, that would be worth it.‚Äù ‚Üí succinct yet powerful.

Binny partnered with Saikiran who worked at Flipkart and was a Senior Partner @ McKinsey for 15 years prior; Sai is a co-founder of the firm along with Neeraj Aggarwal (ex VP at Flipkart)

3 years after founding, the firm was profitable. And, on 9th Feb ‚Äò22, Binny topped the company up with $25M in funding (from his own pocket). We don‚Äôt have latest data on company performance, since it is SG domiciled, but FY23 was ~$14M in revenue & profitable.

xto10x combines the traditional ‚ÄòMcKinsey model‚Äô i.e. consulting (70% of revenue) with a ‚Äòbuilders approach‚Äô i.e. product / software led engagements (30% of revenue)

‚ÄúPeopleCues‚Äù is their software platform, priced at ~$8 per seat per month, which comprises

(a) OKR management
(b) Performance management
(c) Culture & Employee NPS (eNPS)

In addition to the software, they offer consulting services like:
(1) Coaching ‚Üí Pre-IPO coaching & founder coaching
(2) Strategy ‚Üí Org Design, Leadership hiring etc
(3) Hands-on ‚Üí Growth engine design & implementation

üí°Very similar to McKinsey & its MBB peers, xto10x focuses on having small teams working deeply with large clients (200+ names including CRED, Groww, Razorpay, Meesho etc). Btw, many people don‚Äôt know that McKinsey also has a LOT of software which it sells to clients (topic for another post) - so the two firms are quite similar!

What makes xto10x unique is that alongside consulting fees, it sometimes take an equity stake in companies it works with ‚Üí per TRACXN, it has equity in ~35 companies (mostly at the Series B stage). HENCE, it has real skin in the game üí™

‚û°Ô∏èThe goal ofis clear from the name itself ‚Üí to help founders on the X to 10X journey. As their website says: ‚ÄúScaling is hard. We make it easier.‚Äù This is an interesting n::1 business!

‚Ä¶more
